Good Blog Commenting - Everything You Should Understand

Effective blog commenting is one of the easiest ways to get relevant backlinks to your website or blog, and the at the same time drive quality traffic directly from the comments that you post. However, in order to make this strategy work you need to keep in mind a few factors, or else it may just backfire and your effort might prove fruitless. The biggest hurdles faced by IMers and webmasters alike are finding the best blogs to comment on and then making sure that those comments get approved. Keep reading to learn a few of the things that you should do to find success with blog commenting.

Limit to One Comment Per Day, Per Blog: The very first thing that you have to remember when you start blog commenting is that you should not leave more than one comment per day per blog that you decide to target. Do not go overboard when you comment, even if you've got something relevant to say. This is important because it prevents the blog owner from mistaking you for someone who is attempting to get attention via spamming. However, it's a completely different thing when you're having a conversation with the blogger or any other reader in the comments section - that's when it completely makes sense to make multiple comments.

Target Blogs That You're Comfortable With: In terms of blog commenting it is important to only spend your time commenting on blogs you feel comfortable commenting on. Now, there are times when you'll find a blog interesting even though it's not related to your own website or blog, and is altogether from a different niche. But if this blog is something that you're comfortable commenting on and the subject is of your interest, you should go for it. The point is that you should only leave comments that are genuine and useful and that only happens when you are genuinely interested in the content. So as an example, if you're commenting on the http://www.creditrestoreusa.com blog, you should see to it that the comment is relevant.

Compliment the Blogger: Before you actually get to the point of your comment make sure you're complimenting the blogger so that he or she will have incentive to bite. The compliment needs to be honest and it should have something to do with the post on which you are commenting. This can help you feel good and let the blogger know that you're a real person and that you're being honest. However, don't start off with flattery as that's the last thing you should do - it'll make you look fake and give an impression like you're trying to impress the blogger for nothing. Find a balance between good words and comment content.

Every single step that you take towards making meaningful comments on a blog and to get it approved will help you get an inch closer to getting a quality backlink, and possibly some targeted traffic. This is why you should be determined enough to find success with blog commenting without really giving up on it. You will have ups and downs as you keep moving and if you can make it through them you will see that blog commenting has all sorts of advantages.
